page.title: 19CONSERVATION AND WILDLIFE
page.content:
shops selling antiques,gifts,expensive clothes and afternoon teas. {Conservation rules:}The house fronts must remain unchanged,extensions must be built at the back and built as part of the dwelling and colours for painting must be muted
{Wildlife in Eaglesham} We have studied six different habitat types:Moorland,Loch,Riverside,Agricul tural,Woodland and garden.We found that although the different animals and birds live in separate habitats there is a gradual change as one habitat merges into another.Thus we found woodland birds in bushes round lochs and field borders. We also found evidence of change of land use.clumps of wood anemones in woodland showed it had once been woodland.The Wildlife Trust has an Eaglesham branch..... _
